abstract: South Korean legislators Lee Cheol-woo and Shin Kyoung-min report country’s National Intelligence Service believes North Korea will conduct another nuclear test at unspecified date.
lead_paragraph: South Korean lawmakers, after a closed-door parliamentary session with officials from the spy agency, said the country was monitoring the North’s nuclear facilities.

headline.main: North Korea Said to Be Preparing for Nuclear Test
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; South Korea: North May Be Preparing for Nuclear Test

snippet: South Korean lawmakers, after a closed-door parliamentary session with officials from the spy agency, said the country was monitoring the North’s nuclear facilities.
